Package de.garden.sensors

Class SoilMoisture

java.lang.Object
de.garden.sensors.SoilMoisture
Direct Known Subclasses:
SoilMoistureDB
public class SoilMoisture
extends java.lang.Object
Reading data form sensor SoilMoisture

SoilMonsure is the sensor that can read temperature,
sunlight in lux and soil moisture

Author:
grzeg

    java.lang.String toString()  
    java.lang.String wetterErd()
    Here we use 'moinsture' parametr to know how
    soil moinsture is in erde

    We have 2 strings outputs possibilitys
    '0 - 49' Erde is dry
    '50 - 100' Erde is wet
    java.lang.String wetterLux()
    Here we use sunlight 'lux' parametr to know how
    cloudy is sky right now

    We have 4 strings outputs possibilitys
    '0 - 24' no sunlight, night
    '25 - 49' cloudy sky, no sunlight, maybe rain come
    '50 - 74' partly clouds and sun
    '75 - 100' fullsunlight, day, no clouds
    java.lang.String wetterTemp()
    Here we use 'temperature' parametr to know
    how will plants grows

    We have 3 strings outputs possibilitys
    '0 - 16' It is to cold
    '17 - 21' It is optimal
    '22 - and higer' It is comfortable

    getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • wetterLux

      public java.lang.String wetterLux()
      Here we use sunlight 'lux' parametr to know how
      cloudy is sky right now

      We have 4 strings outputs possibilitys
      '0 - 24' no sunlight, night
      '25 - 49' cloudy sky, no sunlight, maybe rain come
      '50 - 74' partly clouds and sun
      '75 - 100' fullsunlight, day, no clouds

      Returns:
      how cloudy is right now

    • wetterErd

      public java.lang.String wetterErd()
      Here we use 'moinsture' parametr to know how
      soil moinsture is in erde

      We have 2 strings outputs possibilitys
      '0 - 49' Erde is dry
      '50 - 100' Erde is wet

      Returns:
      how dry erde is right now

    • wetterTemp

      public java.lang.String wetterTemp()
      Here we use 'temperature' parametr to know
      how will plants grows

      We have 3 strings outputs possibilitys
      '0 - 16' It is to cold
      '17 - 21' It is optimal
      '22 - and higer' It is comfortable

      Returns:
      actual string wether
